questions.question_text: Which keyboard shortcut creates a new blank workbook in Excel?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + N is the keyboard shortcut for creating a new blank workbook in Excel.

questions.question_text: What is the intersection of a row and column called in Excel?
questions.explanation: A cell is the intersection point of a row and column where data is entered.

questions.question_text: Which area of the Excel interface shows the content of the active cell?
questions.explanation: The Formula Bar displays the content (text, numbers, or formulas) of the currently selected cell.

questions.question_text: How do you rename a worksheet in Excel?
options: Right-click the sheet tab and select Rename
Use the Format menu on the Home tab
questions.explanation: You can rename a worksheet by either double-clicking the sheet tab or right-clicking and selecting Rename.

questions.question_text: Which keyboard shortcut saves the current workbook?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + S saves the current workbook. It's recommended to use this shortcut frequently.

questions.question_text: What does the small square at the bottom-right corner of a selected cell allow you to do?
questions.explanation: This is called the fill handle, which allows you to AutoFill data, formulas, or series.

questions.question_text: Which keyboard shortcut inserts a hyperlink in Excel?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + K opens the Insert Hyperlink dialog box in Excel.

questions.question_text: What is the default file extension for Excel workbooks (2019)?
questions.explanation: .xlsx is the default file format for Excel workbooks since Excel 2007.

questions.question_text: Which feature allows you to jump to a specific cell in Excel?
options: Type the cell address in the Name Box
questions.explanation: All these methods allow you to navigate to a specific cell in Excel.

questions.question_text: Where would you find the sum, average, or count of selected cells in Excel?
questions.explanation: The Status Bar at the bottom of the Excel window shows calculations like sum, average, and count of selected cells.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a valid data type in Excel?
questions.explanation: While you can insert pictures in Excel, they are not considered a data type. Text, numbers, and dates/times are the primary data types.

questions.question_text: What happens when you press F2 while a cell is selected?
questions.explanation: Pressing F2 allows you to edit the contents of the active cell directly.

questions.question_text: Which tab on the Ribbon would you use to insert a hyperlink?
questions.explanation: The Insert tab contains the Link button for inserting hyperlinks.

questions.question_text: What is a named range in Excel?
options: A range with a specific color
A descriptive name for a cell or group of cells
A locked range that cannot be edited
A range that contains only numbers
questions.explanation: A named range is a descriptive name given to a cell or range of cells for easier reference in formulas and navigation.

questions.question_text: How do you select an entire worksheet in Excel?
options: Click the Select All button (triangle at top-left corner)
questions.explanation: You can select the entire worksheet by clicking the Select All button or pressing Ctrl + A twice.

questions.question_text: Which file format is best for importing/exporting plain text data without formatting?
questions.explanation: CSV (Comma Separated Values) format stores plain text data without formatting, making it ideal for data exchange.

questions.question_text: Where is the Quick Access Toolbar located in Excel?
questions.explanation: The Quick Access Toolbar is located at the top-left corner of the Excel window, above the Ribbon.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the Text Import Wizard in Excel?
options: To create formatted text in cells
To import data from .txt or .csv files
To check spelling in the workbook
questions.explanation: The Text Import Wizard helps you properly import and structure data from text files (.txt) or CSV files.

questions.question_text: Which keyboard shortcut opens an existing workbook?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + O opens the Open dialog box to browse and open existing workbooks.

questions.question_text: How are numbers typically aligned in Excel cells by default?
questions.explanation: Numbers are right-aligned by default in Excel, while text is left-aligned.
